moves.1. e4 c5 2. Nf3 Nf6 3. e5 Nd5: I gave valeriuzaharia the same treat, and that worked...
moves.4. Nc3 Nxc3 5. dxc3 d5: So far, so good. We reached the Nimzowitsch/Rubinstein counter-gambit, with d5...
moves.6. Bb5+: Ignores the gambit... He had probably seen my game against valeriuzaharia...
moves.6... Nc6 7. O-O Bf5: I preferred this over 7. ... a6 8. Bxc6 bxc6 9. Re1... 8. Bxc6+ bxc6, is pointless now... The Sicilian worked...
moves.8. Qe2: Surely, not best... 8. Nh4 was sounder...
moves.8... a6 9. Bxc6+ bxc6 10. Nh4: Meaningless, now... 10. c4, was strongly recommended...
moves.10... Bc8: The trick move... After Bb7, black gains strong control, over the center...
moves.11. Be3: Completing development... Considering blacks standard reply, surely not strongest. Black wins the opening stage...
moves.12. Nf3: I would have considered 12. b3 Qc7 13. f4...
moves.14. Rd4 Bxf3 15. Qxf3 e6: All is well, on the Eastern Front...
moves.16. Rg4: Trying, to make something out of nothing... Better was 16. Rfd1, to my taste...
moves.17... h5: 17. ... Qxe5 18. Rxc4! leads to complications now... Rg4 is not sound...
moves.18. Rh4: 18. Rg5 g6, leads to equal play, now...
As noted... Follows a - somewhat forced - continuation...
moves.22. Bd2 Qf5 23. Qxf5 exf5 24. c4 Rfe8 25: White wanders in the dark. 27. Rd4 is better... 24. c4 is best...
moves.28. Bd2: I would at least have tried 28. Bb4...
moves.28... Kf7 29. c3: White offered draw... After 29. ... Rb8 30. b3, we are dead equal... So I accepted...
